intro: Chazaliella ramisulca, commonly known as the slender chazal, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in late spring, attracting various pollinators. Chazaliella ramisulca is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and low maintenance requirements.
